  {}

  {\def\RSthmtxt{theorem~}\newref{thm}{name = \RSthmtxt}}
  {}

  {\def\RSlemtxt{lemma~}\newref{lem}{name = \RSlemtxt}}
  {}

\newenvironment{lyxlist}[1]
{\begin{list}{}
{\settowidth{\labelwidth}{#1}
 \setlength{\leftmargin}{\labelwidth}
 \addtolength{\leftmargin}{\labelsep}
 \renewcommand{\makelabel}[1]{##1\hfil}}}
{\end{list}}

\usepackage{babel}
\begin{document}

\title{\emph{Open Innovation Projects} - entries in the \emph{energy }category}


\subtitle{Website's content (partial) in one document and extrapolation of
OIP's categorization to projects not listed by OIP. This particular
document is solely dedicated to entries in relation with the OSHWL
field \emph{energy}.}


\author{Léonard Favre}

\maketitle
Aug. 2013

\tableofcontents{}

\listoftables


\pagebreak{}


\section{Introduction}

open-innovation-projects.org (\emph{OIP} in the text following) lists
mostly OSHW projects and systematically categorizes them. Out of the
\textsubscript{\textasciitilde{}}150 listed entries, 109 retained
our attention. Out of those 109, the following 5 are directly in relation
with the OSHWL field \emph{energy} (\tabref{OIP-entries-direct}):

\begin{table}[H]
\noindent \begin{raggedright}
\begin{tabular}{|c|c|c|c|}
\hline 
title & OSHWL path & short description & keywords from OIP\tabularnewline
\hline 
\hline 
\textbf{3G Stoves} & energy/thermal/stoves &  & stove, 3g, woodgas, tlud, biomass\tabularnewline
\hline 
\textbf{Absorber Roof} & energy/solar/thermal &  & solar, thermal, collector, roof, intergrated\tabularnewline
\hline 
\multirow{3}{*}{\textbf{Greenwatts{*}}} & \multirow{3}{*}{energy} &  & solar, energy, green, DIY, alternative,\tabularnewline
 &  &  & sun, heating, electricity, solar cooking,\tabularnewline
 &  &  & solar concentration, heliostat\tabularnewline
\hline 
\textbf{OS BHKW} & energy/thermal/cogen &  & -\tabularnewline
\hline 
\textbf{Solar Cooking} & \multirow{2}{*}{energy/solar/thermal} &  & \multirow{2}{*}{-}\tabularnewline
\textbf{Archive (SCA)} &  &  & \tabularnewline
\hline 
\end{tabular} 
\par\end{raggedright}

\caption{OIP entries treated by OSHWL, directly in relation with the OSHWL
field \emph{energy}\label{tab:OIP-entries-direct}}


{*}: Greenwatts is the merger of two OIP entries that lead to the
same project (Greenwatts): \emph{Canuckles} and \emph{solar tracking}.
\end{table}


\noindent \begin{flushleft}
We will also apply the same ``standardized'' categorization effort
to the following OSHWL \emph{energy} projects, not listed by OIP (\tabref{OSHWL-projects-categorized}):
\par\end{flushleft}

\begin{table}[H]

title & OSHWL path & short description\tabularnewline
\hline

\emph{SolarFire} & energy/solar/thermal & \tabularnewline
\hline 
\emph{SolarFlower} & energy/solar/thermal & \tabularnewline
\hline 
\end{tabular}

\caption{other OSHWL projects categorized according to OIP's method\label{tab:OSHWL-projects-categorized}}
\end{table}

to us. Those 16 seem \emph{indirectly} in relation with the OSHWL
field \emph{energy} (\tabref{OIP-entries-indirect}):

\caption{OIP entries treated by OSHWL, \emph{indirectly} in relation with the
OSHWL field \emph{energy\label{tab:OIP-entries-indirect}}}
\end{table}


\pagebreak{}

The following is the categorization itself (in tables making overview
and comparison easy, as opposed to individual project sheets as is
the case on open-innovation-projects.org), copied from OIP for the
projects they list and complemented with the projects from \tabref{OSHWL-projects-categorized}.

OIP groups criteria in three categories:
\begin{itemize}
\item project details
\item (product details) removed in this document
\item institutional design and production
\end{itemize}
Much of the information OIP provides was ignored in this document,
mostly because of perceived subjectivity and lack of comparability. 


\section{Project details}

First, a description of the categories in the tables directly following.


\paragraph{project type}
\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{single\ project\hspace{3.3em}}] \noindent one or more specific
product(s) is/are shown and/or developed 
\item [{collection\ of\ projects}] overview over several different projects
or product, e.g. OIP itself
\end{lyxlist}

\paragraph{development Status}

current stage of development according to the following:
\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{1}] planning/virtual development - ideas and digital dev. evolving 
\item [{2}] prototyping started - first physical proto. assembled, testing
phase 
\item [{3}] first working proto. - working proto. available, release to
community, further dev. needed 
\item [{4}] production stable - fully functional product permanently available
on market, further dev. possible 
\item [{5}] mature - final dev. stage reached, no further dev. necessary 
\item [{Inactive}] dev. stopped, no final product available
\end{lyxlist}
in case several products are being developed, the stage of the most
advanced product is indicated. 


\paragraph{license and trademark}
\begin{itemize}
\item whether the project is using an open license and of which type
\item whether they have a registered trademark
\end{itemize}

\paragraph{country}

main location, i.e. home country of the project leader, the core team
or the office location. 


\paragraph{start year}

year in which the project was initiated.

\begin{table}[H]
\begin{tabular}{|c|cc|c|ccccccc|c|c|}
\hline 
\multirow{2}{*}{title} & \multicolumn{2}{c|}{entry type} & \multirow{2}{*}{\begin{sideways}
dev. status
\end{sideways}} & \multicolumn{7}{c|}{licence (and TM)} & \multirow{2}{*}{\begin{sideways}
country
\end{sideways}} & \multirow{2}{*}{\begin{sideways}
start year
\end{sideways}}\tabularnewline
 & \begin{sideways}
collection of projects
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
single project
\end{sideways} &  & \begin{sideways}
GPL, LGPL or similar copyleft
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
BSD, MIT or similar permissive
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
Creative Commons
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
other open
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
commercial
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
no license
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
registered trademark
\end{sideways} &  & \tabularnewline
\hline

\pagebreak{}


\section{Institutional design and production}

First, a description of the categories in the table directly following.


\paragraph*{contribution}
\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{(user}] whether private persons or users are actively involved
in the development. ) \emph{is the case for all entries}
\item [{commercial}] whether commercial companies are actively involved
in the development. 
\item [{research}] whether research institutions are actively involved
in the development. 
\end{lyxlist}

\paragraph*{type of collaboration}
\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{\emph{collective\ development\ of...}}]~

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{\emph{one}{\small \ }\emph{common}{\small \ }\emph{product}}] if
a community is commonly developing one product. 
\item [{\emph{several}{\small \ }\emph{common}{\small \ }\emph{products}}] if
a community is commonly developing several different products. 
\end{lyxlist}
\item [{\emph{published\ knowledge...}}]~

\begin{lyxlist}{00.00.0000}
\item [{\emph{with}{\small \ }\emph{some}{\small \ }\emph{coll}{\small .\ }\emph{dev.}}] if
instructions or ideas are published and others make comments and suggestions. 
\item [{\emph{without}{\small \ }\emph{collective}{\small \ }\emph{dev.}}] if
information is purely revealed. 
\end{lyxlist}
\end{lyxlist}

\paragraph*{degree of openness (radicalized from OIP's version) / entirety of
openness}

Whether or not the project is revealing all available information.
It might be interesting to systematically ask again/verify this.


\paragraph*{production}

entity responsible for production. ``related company or assoc.''
refers to an entity closely related to the project or with a production
mandate. \textquotedbl{}outsourced\textquotedbl{} is whenever an external
party is paid for supplying components. \vfill{}
\pagebreak{}

\begin{table}[H]
\begin{tabular}{|l|ll|cccc|c|cccccccc|}
\hline 
\multirow{2}{*}{title} & \multicolumn{2}{c|}{contribution} & \multicolumn{4}{c|}{type of collab.} & \multirow{2}{*}{\begin{sideways}
entirety of openness, as ticked or not in OIP
\end{sideways}} & \multicolumn{8}{c|}{product produced by}\tabularnewline
 & \begin{sideways}
commercial
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
research
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
collective development of\emph{ one }common product
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
collective development of \emph{several} common products
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
published knowledge\emph{ w/ }collective development
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
published knowledge\emph{ w/o }collective development
\end{sideways} &  & \begin{sideways}
project leader
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
core team
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
developer community
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
user community
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
related company or association
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
outsourced
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
other
\end{sideways} & \begin{sideways}
not yet clear
\end{sideways}\tabularnewline
\hline
